elements.title: Magna Lykseth
elements.contents: ... that Magna Lykseth appeared as Isolde (pictured) when Wagner's Tristan und Isolde was first performed at the Royal Swedish Opera in 1909?

elements.title: KCLV
elements.contents: ... that Sunday-school classes were once held in the transmitter building of New Mexico radio station KCLV?

elements.title: Anne Gunn
elements.contents: ... that Scottish inventor and music teacher Anne Gunn was granted the first British patent for a board game in 1801?

elements.title: Concurrent Computer Corporation
elements.contents: ... that Concurrent Computer Corporation was consumed in a "minnow-swallows-the-whale" merger during the junk bonds era, but unusually, kept its name, CEO, and headquarters?

elements.title: Joshua George Beard
elements.contents: ... that Joshua George Beard was a member of the first Toronto City Council and the first Toronto School Board of Trustees?

elements.title: shōjo manga
elements.contents: ... that until the 1970s, most shōjo manga (Japanese girls' comics) were written by men?

elements.title: Claudia Riner
elements.contents: ... that Claudia Riner was falsely accused of distributing lesbian erotica in the Kentucky House of Representatives?

elements.title: Conrad Bangkok
elements.contents: ... that on the day the Conrad Bangkok hotel opened in 2003, ten people climbed up its walls dressed as Spider-Man?
